name: Hapuna Beach Prince Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and can't wait to go back. Beautiful hotel, clean comfortable rooms, and one of the best beaches on the entire island. We booked through Expedia and had the breakfast buffet included in our rate. I'm glad we did because the breakfast was wonderful, but quite pricey if you had to purchase it separately.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We had no problems with the front desk staff at all. In fact, they upgraded our room for free since it was our honeymoon.
reviews.title: THE MOST RELAXING AND ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: My only complaint about this hotel is that it is very far from anything else. The restaurant on site is nice, but expensive. If you'd like to go somewhere else to eat, it will be at least a 15 minute drive to get to the King shops at the Hilton, and about 40 minutes to get to downtown Kona.
reviews.title: Hapuna Prince Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Pricey but a great place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel
reviews.title: Little piece of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pricelined a 4 night stay at the Hapuna Beach Prince Hotel. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view upon check in. Reception desk gave us a few good suggestions for restaurants in Waimea; Activity desk gave some useful info, but not overly helpful.
reviews.title: Great beach, comfortable room, overall great value

reviews.text: -Location: a bit far from everything, especially good snorkeling; although we did "swim" w/ 3 sea turtles right off the beach
reviews.title: Excellent beach, beautiful views, less than main desk staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Beach: Hapuna Beach and Mauna Kea have the softest prettiest sand ever. The view / sunsets are amazing!! Beautiful views of the ocean everywhere!
reviews.title: We really enjoyed this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Pool: didn't use it
reviews.title: What a disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Food: seemed sorta pricey at the hotel, so we ended up going out to Waimea (20 minute drive) for most of our meals. Being from Los Angeles, the windy drive (no traffic) didn't bother us at all. We also drove out to Waikoloa Village a few times for food.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Rental Car Needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hapuna Prince Beach Hotel for 3 nights in early May. This was our third stay at Hapuna after getting married there on our last trip. It was a relief to arrive after seven nights at the Hilton Waikoloa which was just two big and crowded for our taste.
reviews.title: Great for Quiet and Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had another great stay but I would have to concur that the place is starting to show it’s age a little bit. There are no major issues, but it’s time for some paint here and new furniture there. The most glaring area was the pool furniture. Most of it was very discolored from sun exposure and it just makes a really bad impression. Make no mistake, they are still keeping up with day to day maintenance and cleaning.
reviews.title: Hapuna Beach Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the rooms at Hapuna. The décor is very bright and welcoming. We booked a partial ocean view room and we were upgraded to an ocean view when we checked in. All of the rooms have a big Lanai facing toward the water with a full size lounge chair as well as a table and two other chairs. The lanai is a great spot for a relaxing breakfast (or other meal). The best part is probably the huge bathroom – double sinks and separate shower, tub and toilet. The fridge in the room is convenient for storing drinks and snacks.
reviews.title: Great rooms with a perfect beach!
Terrific property with first class beach and amenities
reviews.text: The highlight of this hotel is the beach of course, with soft white sand and clear water. There wasn’t much surf this trip but there often can be and it makes this beach popular for boogie boarding. As usual there were lots of turtles at the north end of the beach.

We had the best meal of our 14 days in Hawaii at the Coast Grill. We’ve eaten 4-5 times there before and it can be a little hit or miss but we’ve never had a terrible meal there. Regardless, the ambiance is great and the service has always been good. We went to the “Let’s go Crabbing” buffet on Friday. Price is regularly $58pp but they were offering a 20% discount for hotel guest. Crab was good but there wasn’t much to the rest of the buffet. If you really like seafood, splurge and go to the Clambake at the Mauna Kea on Saturday night.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach

reviews.text: I pricelined two nights at the Hapuna Prince in February.
reviews.title: Never disappointed by Prince hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first wonderful thing about the Prince is the free parking. Valet was helpful and took my bags to my room. Front desk was friendly and had no problem finding my reservation. They provide a cool damp towel and glass of juice at check-in.
reviews.title: Wasn't perfect, but came close

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was on the ground level. I would not have noticed that there was some peeling of the wallpaper near the ceiling had I not been looking for it. Furnishings were in great condition, bathtub was BIG, separate shower. Again, I might not have noticed that the shower fixture was old and a bit worn, had I not read previous reviews.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel on a wonderful beach, at a great price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plantation doors opened to lanai with chairs and table -- and a stray black cat. I'm a cat person so this doesn't bother me. Later when I closed the doors and ignored it, it went away, so no harm there.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, except for salon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and view of the ocean are stunning, truly what I would expect in a resort-level hotel (rare in Priceline "resorts". The beach, steps away, is my favorite beach on the Big Island -- long stretch of white sand, turquoise water, excellent snorkeling. Unfortunately it was too windy for the beach when I was there.
reviews.title: Great hotel - even better beach !!!

description: Hapuna Beach Prince Hotel offers luxury accommodations, an 18-hole golf course, spa services, and space for meetings and weddings. Gracious hospitality. Exceptional value. No mandatory resort fees.
